titleStmt.title: King William's welcome; or, A congratulatory poem on His Majesty's happy arriva[l.] Together with the mutual comfort of King and subject, which is fully demonstrated the wise proceedings of the present Parlaiment in suppressing vice, associating and uniting the hearts of His Majesty's subjects. by W.L. Chaplain to one of His Majesty's ships.
titleStmt.author: W. L.

titleStmt.title: King William's welcome; or, A congratulatory poem on His Majesty's happy arriva[l.] Together with the mutual comfort of King and subject, which is fully demonstrated the wise proceedings of the present Parlaiment in suppressing vice, associating and uniting the hearts of His Majesty's subjects. by W.L. publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by J. Bradford, in New-street, without Bishopsgate, near Hand Ally,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
First line: "Welcome great prince, thrice welcome let it be."
Reproduction of original in: British Library.
